report_meta.title: Scattered Spider
report_meta.summary: Joint FBI/CISA/RCMP/ASD’s ACSC/AFP/CCCS/NCSC-UK advisory describing Scattered Spider’s evolving social engineering-driven intrusions, living-off-the-land/RMM usage, data theft for extortion, and recent deployment of DragonForce ransomware; includes MITRE ATT&CK mappings and mitigations.

intrusion_sets.name: Scattered Spider
intrusion_sets.description: Cybercriminal group targeting large enterprises and IT help desks; uses multifaceted social engineering (phishing, vishing, SIM swaps), RMM tools and LOTL techniques for access, persistence, data theft/extortion, and—recently—DragonForce ransomware encryption.

malware.name: AveMaria
malware.description: Provides remote access to targeted systems as part of Scattered Spider operations.

malware.name: Raccoon Stealer
malware.description: Steals credentials, browser history, cookies, and other data to support access and discovery.

malware.name: VIDAR Stealer
malware.description: Information stealer used to obtain credentials and browser data.

malware.name: RattyRAT
malware.description: Java-based RAT used for persistent, stealth access and internal reconnaissance.

malware.name: DragonForce
malware.description: Encrypts networks (including VMware ESXi) for ransom following data exfiltration.

tools.name: Ngrok
tools.description: Public tunneling service to expose internal services over the internet.

tools.name: Fleetdeck.io
tools.description: Legitimate RMM platform repurposed for access/persistence.

tools.name: Level.io
tools.description: Legitimate RMM platform used to manage compromised hosts.

tools.name: ScreenConnect
tools.description: Remote access tool leveraged for command and control and lateral movement.

tools.name: Splashtop
tools.description: Remote access software used for persistence and control.

tools.name: Tactical.RMM
tools.description: Open-source RMM used to manage compromised endpoints.

tools.name: TeamViewer
tools.description: Remote access tool used for interactive control.

tools.name: AnyDesk
tools.description: Remote access tool leveraged to bypass alerts as a legitimate application.

tools.name: Teleport.sh
tools.description: Tunneling/remote access to local systems over the internet.

infrastructure.name: Impersonation/SSO-helpdesk phishing domains
infrastructure.description: Organization-specific lookalike domains combining target names with terms like SSO/helpdesk (e.g., targetsname-sso[.]com, targetsname-helpdesk[.]com, oktalogin-targetcompany[.]com).

infrastructure.name: Data exfiltration via cloud services
infrastructure.description: Exfiltration to cloud services including Snowflake and MEGA; references to U.S.-based data centers such as Amazon S3.

infrastructure.name: Proxy networks
infrastructure.description: Use of proxy networks and rotating machine names to mask source and hamper detection.

courses_of_action.name: Maintain offline, regularly tested backups
courses_of_action.description: Keep encrypted, immutable offline backups stored separately; test restorations to limit disruption from extortion/ransomware.
courses_of_action.x_mapped_from_text: “Maintain offline backups of data … tested regularly.”

courses_of_action.name: Enable phishing-resistant MFA (FIDO/WebAuthn/PKI)
courses_of_action.description: Adopt phishing-resistant MFA to defeat push bombing, SIM swaps, and OTP theft.

courses_of_action.name: Implement application allowlisting and control RMM
courses_of_action.description: Allowlist software; audit, restrict, and monitor remote access tools; block unauthorized portable executables.
courses_of_action.x_mapped_from_text: “Implement application controls … allowlisting remote access programs.”

courses_of_action.name: Harden and limit RDP
courses_of_action.description: Audit/use only when necessary; close unused ports; enforce account lockouts; require phishing-resistant MFA; log and monitor RDP.
courses_of_action.x_mapped_from_text: “Strictly limit the use of Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) … apply best practices.”

courses_of_action.name: Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities
courses_of_action.description: Keep OS/software/firmware updated; prioritize KEV items on internet-facing systems.
courses_of_action.x_mapped_from_text: “Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date … Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities …”

courses_of_action.name: Segment networks and monitor for lateral movement
courses_of_action.description: Use segmentation to constrain spread; deploy EDR/network telemetry; detect abnormal RMM and cloud instance usage.
courses_of_action.x_mapped_from_text: “Segment networks … Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity … EDR tools …”

courses_of_action.name: Enhance monitoring for risky logins and account misuse
courses_of_action.description: Continuously monitor for suspicious sign-ins and unusual behavior to catch identity abuse.
courses_of_action.x_mapped_from_text: “Enhance monitoring against unauthorized account misuse … ‘risky logins’ …”

courses_of_action.name: Disable unused ports/protocols and harden email
courses_of_action.description: Disable unused services; add external banners; consider disabling hyperlinks in inbound emails.
courses_of_action.x_mapped_from_text: “Disable unused ports and protocols … Consider adding an email banner … Disable hyperlinks …”

reports.name: AA23-320A Scattered Spider
reports.description: Updated multi-agency advisory on Scattered Spider’s TTPs, new malware/ransomware usage (including DragonForce), cloud data exfiltration patterns (e.g., Snowflake/MEGA), and prioritized mitigations mapped to ATT&CK.
object_summary: Intrusion Set: Scattered Spider (aliases: UNC3944, Scatter Swine, Oktapus, Octo Tempest, Storm-0875, Muddled Libra)
Malware: AveMaria/WarZone, Raccoon Stealer, VIDAR Stealer, RattyRAT, DragonForce ransomware
Tools: Mimikatz; RMM/tunneling tools incl. AnyDesk, TeamViewer, ScreenConnect, Splashtop, Fleetdeck.io, Level.io, Pulseway, Tactical.RMM, Tailscale, Ngrok, Teleport.sh
Infrastructure: phishing lookalike domains; cloud exfiltration via Snowflake/MEGA/Amazon S3; proxy networks
